title: Romantic Valentine single-page surprise for Shivani with neon outlined hearts, evasive 'no' button, and meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic experience that asks: "Shivani,\nWill you be my Valentine?" and presents exactly two choices labeled "yess" and "i dont like you".

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... to ask her to be my valentine, her name is Shivani.

There should be two options: yess or i dont like you .

acceptanceCriteria: The initial screen shows the name "Shivani," and the question "Will you be my Valentine?"
Exactly two interactive buttons are visible: "yess" and "i dont like you"
The page remains a single-screen/single-purpose flow (no extra navigation or features)

requirements.text: Implement a live animated full-viewport background of many small neon hollow outlined hearts that continuously float upward from the bottom of the viewport to the top, using a pink-and-white neon palette.

quotes: The background of the pages should be a live wallpaper of small neon hollow highlighted outlined hearts floating from the bottom of the page to up.
The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white neon color heart scheme

acceptanceCriteria: The heart shapes are visually hollow/outlined (stroke-based), not solid-filled
Hearts continuously spawn/loop from bottom-to-top and cover the full viewport behind the content
The color scheme uses pink/white neon styling with a visible glow effect
Animation runs smoothly on iPad Chrome at typical screen sizes

requirements.text: Make the animated hearts background interactive so user input (mouse move on desktop and touch on iPad) visibly affects nearby hearts (e.g., gentle repulsion/drift/glow change) while keeping the upward floating motion.

quotes: the hearts should float upwards be fully interactive using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: Moving the pointer on desktop causes a visible local effect on nearby hearts
Touching/dragging on iPad causes a similar visible local effect on nearby hearts
Interactivity does not break the continuous upward floating behavior

requirements.text: Make the "i dont like you" button evade interaction so it cannot be clicked: on hover (desktop) and on attempted tap/press (touch devices), it moves to a new on-screen position that stays within the viewport and avoids overlapping the main "yess" area.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over Nope, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on yess.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: moving the cursor onto the "i dont like you" button causes it to relocate before it can be clicked
On iPad/touch: attempting to press/tap the "i dont like you" button triggers relocation instead of activation
The relocated position remains fully within the viewport bounds (not off-screen)
The evasive behavior remains reliable across repeated attempts

requirements.text: When the user clicks "yess", transition to a celebratory success state that displays a meme image and the exact text: "Hehehe Good gurl üòöüíó".

quotes: When she clicks Yess, show her a meme image telling her "Hehehe Good gurl üòöüíó‚Äù.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "yess" switches the UI into a success/reveal screen
The success screen shows the meme image and renders the exact text "Hehehe Good gurl üòöüíó"
The romantic neon theme remains consistent on the success screen

requirements.text: Add the required generated static meme image under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and render it directly from the frontend (no backend fetch).

quotes: When she clicks Yess, show her a meme image telling her "Hehehe Good gurl üòöüíó‚Äù.

acceptanceCriteria: A static asset exists at `frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png`
The success screen loads the image via a direct static path (e.g., `/assets/generated/...`)
The app works when opened in iPad Chrome without requiring any backend calls for the image

constraints: Frontend must remain compatible with iPad Chrome (touch input supported).
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or the immutable hook/entry paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend is not required for this single-page interactive experience; avoid adding unnecessary backend logic.
nonGoals: Do not add multi-page routing, accounts, or authentication flows (Internet Identity not needed for this experience).
Do not add external API integrations or third-party services.
Do not add payments, messaging, or any real-time server features.
